abstract.text: Creates a Core Graphics image from a vImage buffer.

inlineContent.text: The source vImage buffer.
The image format of the source vImage buffer. If the format’s color space is
, the function uses sRGB. The new Core Graphics image retains the color space.
A callback function that deallocates the source buffer’s data when the returned image no longer needs it. Pass this callback when you call this function in no-copy mode; that is, when you pass
to
. The system may call this function at any time — including before
returns — and from any thread.
The value that passes to the
function’s
parameter.
The options to use when performing the operation. If your code implements its own tiling or its own multithreading, pass
; otherwise, pass
Pass
to specify that the function runs in no-copy mode. In this case, the function passes the ownership of the source vImage buffer’s memory to the returned
instance. When you pass this flag, specify the callback function to manage the deallocation of the memory.
Pass
to specify high-quality resampling if the function resamples the output image to a smaller size.
; otherwise, one of the error codes in
The following code shows a passthrough function that generates an output Core Graphics image using no-copy mode. The vImage buffer,
, and the Core Graphics image,
, share the same memory. In this example, the deallocation callback deallocates the memory that the
variable points to:

code: static func passThrough(sourceImage: CGImage) throws -> CGImage? {

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
A flag that uses a higher-quality, slower resampling filter for geometry operations.
A flag that prevents vImage from allocating additional storage.
The vImage function completed without error.
A flag that sets the behavior to the default.
Creates a Core Graphics image from a vImage buffer.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
The description of a Core Graphics image.
A type for image errors.
A type for processing options.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
A bitmap image or image mask.
A bitmap image or image mask.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type for propagating an unmanaged object reference.
